1.text: O ISRAEL, return unto the LORD thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.

2.text: Take with you words, and return unto the LORD: say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and accept that which is good: so will we render as bullocks the offering of our lips.

3.text: Asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Ye are our gods: for in thee the fatherless findeth mercy.

4.text: I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned away from him..

5.text: I will be as the dew unto Israel: he shall blossom as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.

6.text: His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon.

7.text: They that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as the corn, and blossom as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the wine of Lebanon.

8.text: Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have answered, and will regard him: I am like a green fir tree; from me is thy fruit found.

9.text: Who is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and he shall know them? for the ways of the LORD are right, and the just shall walk in them; but transgressors shall fall therein.
